en.meta_title: Dragon Ball Watch Order: Complete Guide 2026 (All Series + Films)
en.meta_description: The complete Dragon Ball watch order with 3 paths: canon only, standard, or completionist. Every series, 23 films, and filler guide. Updated February 2026.
en.intro: Dragon Ball is one of the most sprawling franchises in anime history. Six series, 23 films, non-canon timelines, and the eternal question ‚Äî GT or no GT? This guide cuts through the confusion with three clear watch paths, exact film placement, and a complete filler breakdown.
en.quick_answer: Watch in this order: Dragon Ball ‚Üí Dragon Ball Z (or Kai) ‚Üí Dragon Ball Super ‚Üí Dragon Ball Daima. Insert Super: Broly right after DBS episode 131, then Super Hero after that. Skip GT unless you want everything ‚Äî it‚Äôs non-canon and takes place in an alternate timeline. For films, the only ones that matter are Battle of Gods, Resurrection F, Broly, and Super Hero ‚Äî all others are enjoyable but non-essential.

why_confusing.content:
Unlike most anime, Dragon Ball has been remade, retconned, and expanded over 40 years. Here‚Äôs what trips people up:
  • DBZ vs Dragon Ball Kai ‚Äî Kai is a remastered, heavily trimmed version of DBZ. Same story, ~45% fewer episodes, almost no filler. You don‚Äôt need to watch both.
  • Dragon Ball GT ‚Äî Not written by Toriyama. Mostly disliked by fans. Canon status: officially non-canon since Super was created as the true continuation.
  • The films ‚Äî Out of 23 films, only 4 are canon. The rest are fun standalone stories that don‚Äôt affect the main plot.
  • Dragon Ball Super: Broly ‚Äî This film canonically replaces the two original Broly films. If you‚Äôve seen those, you can still watch this one.

dbz_vs_kai.heading: Dragon Ball Z vs Kai: Which to Watch?
dbz_vs_kai.intro: This is one of the most common questions from newcomers. Here‚Äôs the honest comparison:
dbz_vs_kai.verdict: For 90% of viewers, Dragon Ball Kai is the better choice. It tells the exact same story in 45% less time by cutting the filler and padding that slows down DBZ. The only reason to choose DBZ is if you specifically want the original animation style or the classic Faulconer soundtrack (Western dub). You can always go back to the full DBZ later.

faq.question: Should I watch Dragon Ball GT?
faq.answer: Only if you want to see everything Dragon Ball has to offer. GT is non-canon ‚Äî it was created by Toei Animation without Akira Toriyama‚Äôs involvement, and Dragon Ball Super was later created as the official continuation, effectively replacing GT. Most fans recommend skipping it, at least on a first watch. If you‚Äôre curious, watch it after finishing Super and Daima.

faq.question: Is Dragon Ball GT canon?
faq.answer: No. GT is officially non-canon. When Toriyama created Dragon Ball Super, he explicitly stated it was the true continuation after the Majin Buu Saga, which made GT an alternate timeline. You won‚Äôt miss anything story-relevant by skipping it.

faq.question: Do I need to watch Dragon Ball before Dragon Ball Z?
faq.answer: Technically no, but strongly recommended. Dragon Ball introduces all the core characters, Goku‚Äôs origin, the Dragon Balls themselves, and the early power system. Many emotional moments in DBZ hit harder when you know the characters from the beginning. Plan for around 50 hours ‚Äî it‚Äôs worth it.

faq.question: Where can I watch all of Dragon Ball?
faq.answer: Crunchyroll is your best single destination ‚Äî it has Dragon Ball, DBZ, Kai, Super, GT, Daima, and most films. Netflix has a partial selection including recent films. Amazon Prime Video also carries the main series. For film completionists, some older non-canon films may require purchase on digital platforms.

faq.question: How long does it take to watch all of Dragon Ball?
faq.answer: It depends heavily on your path. Canon essentials only (Kai + Super + Daima + 4 canon films): roughly 350 hours. The standard experience with DBZ and recommended films: around 360 hours. The full completionist path including GT and all 23 films: 900+ hours. Most people binge the essential path over 3‚Äì6 months watching a few episodes per day.

faq.question: What order should I watch the Dragon Ball Super movies?
faq.answer: Battle of Gods first (it introduces Beerus and Super Saiyan God), then Resurrection ‚ÄòF‚Äô (Frieza returns), then watch Dragon Ball Super the series (you can skip episodes 1‚Äì27 since the films cover that arc). After the series ends at episode 131, watch Super: Broly, then Super Hero, then Daima.
